de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht.centralized
Class ClientNode

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.AbstractOverlayNode
      de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht.centralized.ClientNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, ComponentEventListener, ConnectivityListener, OperationCallback, SupportOperations, DHTNode, OverlayNode
public class ClientNode
extends AbstractOverlayNode
implements DHTNode

Client implementation for the server-based pseudo-dht. All store and lookup requests will be forwarded to the server, which has the global view of the system.

Version:
0.1, 09.07.2007
Author:
Konstantin Pussep

getClientID

public OverlayIDImpl getClientID()

join

public int join(OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: DHTNode
Invoking this method bootstraps an OverlayNode into the overlay network. After the bootstraping process is finished, the registered OverlayEventHandler listening on handerId will be informed using an OverlayEvent.

Specified by:
join in interface DHTNode
Parameters:
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result (either operation succeeds with result==null or fails)
Returns:
id of the associated join operation

leave

public int leave(OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: DHTNode
Invoking this method results in leaving the network an OverlayNode is participating in. After the leave operation is finished, the registered OverlayEventHandler listening on handerId will be informed using an OverlayEvent.

Specified by:
leave in interface DHTNode
Parameters:
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result (either operation succeeds with result==null or fails)
Returns:
id of the associated leave operation

store

public int store(OverlayKey key,
                 DHTObject obj,
                 OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: DHTNode
Store the given document with the given key at the responsible node. The result (provided to the caller object) will be an OverlayContact of the node which performed the store operation.

Specified by:
store in interface DHTNode
Parameters:
key - - key of the mapping to store
obj - - value of the mapping to store
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result, i.e. which is either ok (=null) or a failure
Returns:
operation id

valueLookup

public int valueLookup(OverlayKey key,
                       OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: DHTNode
Get the value stored with the given. The result will be an instance of DHTObject or a null reference if such a value was not found.

Specified by:
valueLookup in interface DHTNode
Parameters:
key - - key of the value to look up
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result, i.e. the wanted DHTObject if present in the DHT
Returns:
operation id

createOperation

public Operation createOperation(java.lang.String opName,
                                 java.lang.String[] params,
                                 OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: SupportOperations
Create an appropriate Operation. The component checks whether it can create an operation with the given name and number of parameters. This method is used only to specify operations via configuration (action) files.

Specified by:
createOperation in interface SupportOperations
Parameters:
opName - - operation name
params - - operation parameters if required.
callback - - caller Object which will be informed when the operation finishes (successfully or with a failure)
Returns:
operation - created (can be scheduled or executed immediately)

nodeLookup

public int nodeLookup(OverlayKey key,
                      OperationCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: DHTNode
Get the node responsible for the given key, if a document with such a key does not exist. The result will be an overlay contact.

Specified by:
nodeLookup in interface DHTNode
Parameters:
key - - key of the OverlayNode to lookup
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result, i.e. the TransInfo of the searched node
Returns:
operation id
